title.native: 人生は最高の暇つぶし

description:
Music video animated by Mogelatte for the song Jinsei wa Saikou no Himatsubushi by HoneyWorks featuring Hanon.

The song covers times in Mona's life when she becomes depressed over certain sad subjects, such as discouraging social media interactions, her strained relationship with her older sister, or other things. However, it also covers how she deals with her negative thoughts and how she learns to cope with them.

title.native: ずっと前から好きでした。～告白実行委員会～
ヒロインたるもの！〜嫌われヒロインと内緒のお仕事〜

node.description:
__[Twitter](http://twitter.com/mogelatte)__ | __[Tumblr](https://mogmoge.tumblr.com/)__ | __[Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/73837)__

__Mogelatte__ is a Japanese illustrator, animator, and support member of the circle [HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863/HoneyWorks). Writes BL under the pseudonym Okoge Mochino.

Twitter | Niconico | Instagram Introduction: shito is one of the composers of HoneyWorks, and he also contributes by playing the bass. He's responsible for the composition of most music in the Confession Executive Committee Love Series, while [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) usually helps him with the lyrics. (Source: vocaloid.fandom.com)

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/gom-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_gom_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/gom_honeyworks/)__ Introduction: Gom is one of the earliest utaite, having started uploading covers in March 2007. He is well known for his hot-blooded singing style, putting great energy and passion into his covers, and often screaming loudly. Biography: His most popular cover is of "Okkusenman", which is also his first song covered. It has achieved over 12.49 million views as of the 10th of October 2019. Already in middle school, he wanted to be a "rockstar". On June 15, 2011, he made his major debut with Version Gom DX. Other than singing, he also writes songs, plays guitar, sings, does DTM (desktop music), mixes, and is active as a VOCALOID producer, under the name FernandoP (フェルナンドP), as part of the group "HoneyWorks". Affiliations - Member of HoneyWorks with ChorisP and Yamako - Member of HoneyMonster (Source: utaite.fandom.com)

Twitter | Niconico | Instagram Introduction: shito is one of the composers of HoneyWorks, and he also contributes by playing the bass. He's responsible for the composition of most music in the Confession Executive Committee Love Series, while [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) usually helps him with the lyrics. (Source: vocaloid.fandom.com)

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanon_moco) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJB1hgmiAD4ysg0Ao7uS8Rw) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanon.moco) | [Profile](https://hakoniwalily.jp/profile/)

Known to collaborate with [HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863/HoneyWorks). A member of [HaKoniwalily](https://anilist.co/staff/262082).

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.
